content.raw: I already changed the detection in the gzdev branch, feel free to merge with it to solve the conflicts. gzdev is a blocking or a non-blocking command? if we execute docker run in detech mode it should not be blocking right? In this case we should not need the background call.
content.html: I already changed the detection in the gzdev branch, feel free to merge with it to solve the conflicts. gzdev is a blocking or a non-blocking command? if we execute docker run in detech mode it should not be blocking right? In this case we should not need the background call.

content.raw: There’s one section of code in spawn.py that calls docker logs in streaming mode so that we can log the output of gazebo after running the container in detach mode, then once gazebo is terminated, spawn.py finishes writing the log file and exits. So in Jenkins it would work best if we run gzdev spawn in the background, otherwise we have to comment out that section of code. This would also ensure that the build does not hang and that possible left over processes get cleaned up at the end.
content.html: There’s one section of code in spawn.py that calls docker logs in streaming mode so that we can log the output of gazebo after running the container in detach mode, then once gazebo is terminated, spawn.py finishes writing the log file and exits. So in Jenkins it would work best if we run gzdev spawn in the background, otherwise we have to comment out that section of code. This would also ensure that the build does not hang and that possible left over processes get cleaned up at the end.
